Class ScoreList

  • java.lang.Object
    • ScoreList

  • public class ScoreList
extends java.lang.Object
    The ScoreList class controls the Scores that represent the highscores. It imports the scores from a file, sorts the scores by score and also saves the scores to the file.

    Variable | Type | Description

    Version:
    Version 2.0 May 25, 2012
    Author:
    Branson Lee, Peng Chen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScoreList()
      This constructor calls the importScores method which imports the scores from a file.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<Score> getScores() 
      void importScores()
      This method imports the top ten scores from a file.
      void save()
      This method writes the top ten scores in the scoreList ArrayList to a file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScoreList

        public ScoreList()
        This constructor calls the importScores method which imports the scores from a file. It then calls the sort method to sort the scoreList ArrayList by score.

    • Method Detail

      • importScores

        public void importScores()
        This method imports the top ten scores from a file. The for loops are used to access every score and the if statements check for the header to see if the file is useable.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the file IO fails.

      • save

        public void save()
        This method writes the top ten scores in the scoreList ArrayList to a file. For loop used to access every score.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case the file IO fails.

      • getScores

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Score> getScores()
        Returns:
        ArrayList The top ten scores.
